website_summaries.verdict: Stylish camera strap that resembles a vintage leather model, but it consists of more comfortable and breathable synthetic material.
pros: Should fit nearly any DSLR style camera securely
Width of strap is 1.5 inches, so it won’t dig into your neck and shoulder uncomfortably
Surface of the strap has a little bit of grip, preventing slippage
cons: Looks like leather, but doesn’t have the durability of leather

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking strap. Appears it will hold camera well
customer_reviews.text: Some of the reviews mentioned not using it with a heavy camera. If you use the straps as intended and not the cheap plastic releases on the ends, you should be ok. There were also comments regarding the length of the strap making it difficult to use. I uploaded a pic to show the length on myself, at 5'6" in height. My 6'4" husband also tried it on and said it felt comfy for him as well. The strap is actually a little longer than the Canon strap the camera came with. I like having the strap not advertise the model of the camera. After having my camera stolen last year, that is important to me.
customer_reviews.author: In Cape Coma

customer_reviews.title: Very happy
customer_reviews.text: First time I ever decided to replace my Canon strap, this one is about equal width of my original but a bit more comfortable. Connects easily without extensions and I also bought it for the rustic look with nothing bright or flashy on it because I shoot a lot of wildlife in the outdoors so the neutral color helps. Very happy, a great affordable alternative to any cameras default strap.
customer_reviews.author: James Cormack

customer_reviews.title: Really nice strap!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this strap solely on looks and to my surprise it's a wonderful strap. Well built, solid material, great colors, and super comfortable. You can't beat the old world vintage look and this strap provides just that.
customer_reviews.author: Ashton Monzi

customer_reviews.title: Solid strap, durable and vintage
customer_reviews.text: The neck strap is really nice, I like the vintage feeling it gives to my camera, it also seems pretty solid and durable. Packaging is also pretty neat, however the instructions printed on the packaging aren’t really clear, The ones I found on the amazon listing were better, clearer and bigger. It seems intuitive but it isn’t so just remember to check the listing if you are having issues. other then this I definitely recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Monti

customer_reviews.title: Looks just as pictured.
customer_reviews.text: Not sure how much I trust the little string straps attached to the clips, but I like the convienience the clips provide for quick removal of the strap so for now I'll use them. Good looking strap though. Wuite pleased to recieve it.
customer_reviews.author: Abigail

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable around the neck!
customer_reviews.text: Once I put the strap around my neck, I spent about 30 minutes just checking myself out in the mirror and enjoying how comfortable it was! Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Geem

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality Low Price!!
customer_reviews.text: Loved this! It's really nice and comfortable. I didn't realize when I ordered it, it had a small detail of a camera charm on the side which I thought made it look higher quality. Seems pretty sturdy, I tend to wear my camera on a daily basis so that was key.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: So good looking.
customer_reviews.text: This matches my sisters camera bag and is so cute! She really loves it. Great for a gift if you know a camera person.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very nice and good strap
customer_reviews.text: Hope you got the same in more than two colors. The quality is good, so I’m giving a 5stars review
customer_reviews.author: Victor Herrera

customer_reviews.title: Broken on arrival, not eligible for Amazon return policy.
customer_reviews.text: Broken on arrival, quality is bad, and doesn't even have an option to return it. Really disappointing purchase.
customer_reviews.author: youyou huang

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy for heavy cameras
customer_reviews.text: HEAVY CAMERA USERS BEWARE: The strap slipped off my 5D Mark III while using any lens. I even tied a knot at the end of the strap to make sure the strap didn't slip off. One day i forgot to tie a knot and the "anti-slip surface" strap slipped off my expensive camera, causing it to fall in the middle of a baby shower I was documenting. Haven't used it since. This strap should only be used for lighter compact cameras. Heavier camera users DO NOT BUY.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: but I’m really happy I got this
customer_reviews.text: I know it’s just a camera strap, but I’m really happy I got this. It feels secure when attached to the camera, so you can rest assured there, but it’s also very trendy. It’s got that kind of simple, earthy hipster kind of vibe. I’m into it. It hasn’t hurt my neck, and the fabric itself is pretty soft, also there’s this little metal camera charm on the strap that is pretty cool. Overall, I feel like I scored on this one.
customer_reviews.author: Nikkie NicksTop Contributor: Eye Makeup

customer_reviews.title: Snapped after second use
customer_reviews.text: Great quality, looks great w/ my Canon a1 film camera. Unfortunatrly, the straps attached to the clips snapped after second use, rendering the whole thing unusable. I'll be looking for another strap and suggest you do as well.
customer_reviews.author: obookkenobi

customer_reviews.title: I'm good! I cant dare rationalize a $49
customer_reviews.text: I thought I just needed to get a high end strap for my camera. But once I got this one I realized that I could pan and even follow a lot more stable. Man, I'm good! I can't rationalize a $49.00 strap! This will serve your purpose!
customer_reviews.author: D. GriffinTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight
customer_reviews.text: This neck strap seems made well enough but there are a couple of things that would not work for my needs. 1. The triangular lugs used to connect the strap to the camera did not attach to my camera correctly. 2. The gauge of the web part of the strap was pretty lightweight for daily use. And because of the misfit lugs the straps were not holding to the flat side of the triangle.
customer_reviews.author: C. R. Walker

customer_reviews.title: Strap Broke within 2 days of light use
customer_reviews.text: The main part of the strap is nice, but the part that you use to attach to the camera is very thin. It easily snapped under the weight of a small camera and luckily I caught my camera before it hit the ground. I was not using this strap in any kind of forced or rough way. I can't believe all the good ratings on this strap.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. S

customer_reviews.title: This camera strap has performed very well in some stressful Alaskan conditions.
customer_reviews.text: I wore this strap throughout an almost three week visit to Alaska and Vancouver, and it was very comfortable and secure on my Canon DSLR camera. The strap ties to the camera with strings but they are very strong. Another fastening option was included in the package but I didn't need it. The strap is lightweight so I didn't feel any extra pressure on my shoulders. I am even very pleased with the tan color. I am very glad I purchased this product.
customer_reviews.author: J. A. Mine

customer_reviews.title: love this strap
customer_reviews.text: great strap for my new canon! adds a nice touch without being too loud like some straps with a lot of color. i can't see myself getting sick of this cool pattern. i love the details too. some reviewed that it's shorter than normal canon or nikon straps, it's not that drastic but i like it that way so it isn't swinging around as much
customer_reviews.author: Shan

customer_reviews.title: Not comfortable but it works
customer_reviews.text: It looks pretty good but you pay for what you get. The brown bit is definitely plastic (Polyurethane). The strap itself has nylon webbing as its base on the backside (Mine is black on the back). Where the strap lacks is really in the feel, it isn't soft at all. I tried putting one through the wash which it survived but it didn't make it any softer. If you have sensitive skin i wouldn't buy any of the cheap ones. In the end it serves its purpose and gets the job done. It holds the camera where its supposed to be and doesn't move on me. I have this strap on a Cannon T6.
customer_reviews.author: N.Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and Stylish
customer_reviews.text: I love my new camera strap. Its style was what initially caught my attention and I love how secure it feels on my Canon 3400. No complaints, I'd definitely buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Cruz

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera strap
customer_reviews.text: Love this camera strap. I have it on my FujiFilm x100f and it complements it perfectly. I get numerous compliments on the camera and the strap. The thin ends of the strap would be better in leather in my opinion. But I haven't had any problems with them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great For DSLR Cameras
customer_reviews.text: This is a very comfortable and nice looking strap, I decided to take a chance after reading a few reviews. There's nothing worse than using the strap that comes with your DSLR camera. It's just asking for trouble, and it's tacky. Rule #1 for anyone buying a DSLR camera, get rid of the strap they give you and buy a new one! They're not that expensive, I spent under $10 for this and love it! It's very comfortable around my neck, I can't wait to see how this will hold up during the summer.
customer_reviews.author: Wolftrax

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality Leather Strap
customer_reviews.text: For all my Canon camera users out there, compared to the original strap for our cameras, this one gives more cushion without a doubt. What I can say about that though, I would love to see jut a little bit more of cushion in the padding, as I don't think there is any cushion except for the fabrics. The fabric cushion feels fine, but with like some slight foam or other cushioning material may feel better. Just my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Cybertech

customer_reviews.title: Very, very good for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I've started collecting older film cameras, as well as owning a nice DSLR. Older cameras almost never come with a strap, and if they do, it's usually a thin, dried out, hard as a rock leather strap, and it's just terrible. These Tarion straps are affordable, look great, and are comfy as heck! I love it! One of the best purchases I've ever made, and I intend on purchasing several more, so I can have one for all of my cameras! I do wish their were more colors/designs/patterns to choose from, but dang, for under $10, perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew James

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful!
customer_reviews.text: I liked that strap, mostly because of the color that match my camera, but also because it’s really high quality made! I thinking maybe it’s too wide for my camera but mostly because mine is light.. The little camera on the strap make it even more special!
customer_reviews.author: Dor Dahari

customer_reviews.title: Good Srtap
customer_reviews.text: Looks good and matches my Kodak Retina well, almost like it was made for that camera. Though I just got it so I cant latest to the longevity, it is a comfortable strap and I could wear it all day. I would add a picture but it seems that amazon does not like me so I cant add one.
customer_reviews.author: A.Hilts

customer_reviews.title: Handsome strap, weak hardware
customer_reviews.text: Handsome strap, camera pin is a nice touch. My only real issue with this strap it the flimsy hardware at the ends. They may work just fine for smaller modern cameras but you have to retrofit them with stronger hardware for it to handle a vintage model film camera.
customer_reviews.author: Ian McAndrew

customer_reviews.title: antigravity strap
customer_reviews.text: I like the way it keeps my camera from hitting earth. It does a good job at that.
customer_reviews.author: D733

customer_reviews.title: Nicer in person
customer_reviews.text: Looks really nice in person and a lot sturdier than I’d imagined. My camera isn’t exactly light but I let it hang off with full confidence. I like having a distinct strap to distinguish my camera from others so that’s nice too
customer_reviews.author: Didi

customer_reviews.title: Looks are great, buckles should be metal
customer_reviews.text: This harringbone strap looks great attached to my camera. This is likely why most people will be buying it. If I was a professional, I'd probably be looking elsewhere. Downsides... The underside of the strap isn't the softest, but it's also not the worst I've ever had. I find it comfortable enough to walk around with. What will be the biggest issue are the cheap buckles on each end of the strap. They do not appear to be very durable and I'm concerned they'll crack if they hit anything or take too much abuse. Time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: A bit hard to put the straps on and off
customer_reviews.text: Very nice value and aesthetically pleasing. However as a videographer I need a way to get this strap on and off my camera. I think I will just have to shell out more for Peak design just to do that.. overall the strap is comfortable and good for photographers who doesn't need to use video equipments.
customer_reviews.author: Ericson V.

customer_reviews.title: A Real Bargain
customer_reviews.text: I was shocked at how good the quality was for this cheap camera strap. Really! It has a nice design, looks classy, and is easy to adjust for comfort. If you need a camera strap, you won't go wrong purchasing this one.
customer_reviews.author: Boojiboy1

customer_reviews.title: Looks good. Works well.
customer_reviews.text: Take off those wires and clips and just hard wire it to your camera. I feel more comfortable going on adventures with it that way. It looks good and is made from good materials. Might as well get it if you're looking at my review. I have no regrets.
customer_reviews.author: Dre Freden

customer_reviews.title: Quality and looks nice
customer_reviews.text: This strap surpassed my expectations. It has a nice, vintage look to it, a great color against black or silver, and just looks more expensive than it is.
customer_reviews.author: COSMO BAKER

customer_reviews.title: Vintage feel, durable and fashionable.
customer_reviews.text: This strap is top notch. The few that received damaged goods - I'm sorry you couldn't fully experience how wonderful this works and looks. Its vintage enough to seem worn and used but it's durable and fashionable. It was tough figuring out how to attach it to my camera but I got it eventually. I love the stamps and the little camera pin on it as well.
customer_reviews.author: X. D.

customer_reviews.title: Good price, looks nice
customer_reviews.text: Hubby bought this for a new camera. It looks good, and does the job. Great price.
customer_reviews.author: OpinionatedHijabi

customer_reviews.title: yay
customer_reviews.text: Looks exactly like pic! Comfy and is a good size around my neck. Makes my camera look so cute im excited! The strap + my camera also fits inside my lil camera bag
customer_reviews.author: missak

customer_reviews.title: Low Quality, High Hopes
customer_reviews.text: I could be happier with some higher quality materials, but you only get what you pay for, right? The leather is only on the strap-to-rope connection and it's synthetic and plastic-looking. Pretty much nothing about this looks like a high quality product. That said, it works as intended and looks better than my standard Nikon strap. Eventually when I quit taking photos and get a real job I will invest in some sweet leather.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Ladrech

customer_reviews.title: Best retro strap
customer_reviews.text: Love this strap. Especially the little metal camera pin attached to strap. Looks great with my canon FT QL.
customer_reviews.author: nate

customer_reviews.title: Works and looks good
customer_reviews.text: It's cute and I've been using it for 8+ months with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Kath

customer_reviews.title: The neck strap looks really nice and it really matches the camera bag that I ...
customer_reviews.text: The neck strap looks really nice and it really matches the camera bag that I bought: As of now the strap seems sturdy and it can carry the weight of my canon T7i (800D) and for the price it's really good!
customer_reviews.author: James Santos

customer_reviews.title: I'ld recommend this to amateurs like myself
customer_reviews.text: Straps are a little long but you can just tie or cut them. Used for a 35mm konica and a 35mm olympus, never broke or slipped. I've had it for about 6 months , it's worth the money but it's definitely not built to last a lifetime. I'ld recommend this to amateurs like myself, or students till you really get comfortable with photography no point in shelling out a ton of money on a strap if you don't know what works and what doesn't. It's a good everyday strap or starter strap can be used with multiple cameras.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cute
customer_reviews.text: I love the style of this camera. It is not as thick as I was anticipating but it seems to be sturdy. I wish the material was a little more comfortable for around my neck but it'll do !
customer_reviews.author: Allie

customer_reviews.title: One step closer to becoming a hipster
customer_reviews.text: Very stylish camera strap! Love the color and quality. Only problem was attaching the strap to my camera which took me at least 10 minutes do because of the thick metal piece that connects the two. (Imagine a really thick keychain that hurts your fingernails trying to separate lol). Otherwise, great strap.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Buy this if you hate your camera.
customer_reviews.text: Looks nice, as advertised, sure. Fatal flaw for this strap and your camera; the knot in the sting that loop on to the body of your camera is the same size roughly as the eye of said bracket. Meaning it will come loose and your camera will fall. Steer clear.
customer_reviews.author: Rusty Shakleford

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Okay, so I am really dumb and couldn't figure out how to hook this up to my camera. I got there eventually! Anyway, it is hooked on and looks good. So far it has stayed well onto my camera and hope it continues to.
customer_reviews.author: Kali-billi

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommended
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable, strong, attractive, good-quality strap. I've traveled with mine, and used it with a heavy DSLR and 300mm zoom lens. It's comfortable and doesn't cut into the shoulder like thinner straps. I'm not looking for one for my smaller camera gear.
customer_reviews.author: beejayjr

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for me except the plastic things that are supposed ...
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for me except the plastic things that are supposed to hold the strap ends in place are too large and the strap slips out all the time. The main part of the strap works fine, it does not slip, it's just the little tabs that are supposed to be a place to park the extra strap material.
customer_reviews.author: R. H.

customer_reviews.title: Simple, Dependable Camera neck and shoulder strap
customer_reviews.text: Simple, Dependable Camera neck and shoulder strap at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: D. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Looks good but cheap material
customer_reviews.text: This looks great on pictures but the material is cheap. The pretty side of the strap is slightly softer so if you don’t want to scrape your neck you need to wear it upside down. The bottom layer is really rough. Looks more like a display piece than a usable one.
customer_reviews.author: LG

customer_reviews.title: Stylish strap works as intended.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this strap mainly off of looks alone as most have the same mechanism for holding onto the camera. I purchased this strap to hold my Sony a6000 camera and it does a fantastic job. The strap itself stands out as being of quality construction but also has a pseudo "vintage" appeal to it, which I liked. Overall I am satisfied with this strap and would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: CrackberryC

customer_reviews.title: Great camera strap
customer_reviews.text: This has lasted me for what feels like forever. It’s super comfortable and is still sturdy. I highly recommend this camera strap.
customer_reviews.author: Bella

customer_reviews.title: Camera strap
customer_reviews.text: Brought this camera strap since the one that came with the Sony camera hurt my neck after awhile. I love the brown color and it sits so nicely around my neck. Strap a bit long, however, it is adjustable.
customer_reviews.author: Robin

customer_reviews.title: Brown Camera Strap, Perfect Match
customer_reviews.text: Matched perfectly to the brown camera purchased separately. Well made and excellent material construction.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Alaina Gibbs

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: This is a great camera strap. It’s professional and durable. Not to mention fashionable. What more could I ask for?
customer_reviews.author: TashaFay

customer_reviews.title: Nice alternative basic dslr camera strap
customer_reviews.text: Nice alternative strap for your camera. This strap has a similar quality as the standard black Canon strap. It does not have the rubberized side as the Canon strap. However, the quality seems to be as good as the Canon strap. It's a good alternative strap if you like the design and want to switch things up. To put on the strap to the camera, it's the same way as any other straps where you undo the strap end and slide it through the Camera side holders.
customer_reviews.author: Howard

customer_reviews.title: Nice strap!
customer_reviews.text: A little stiff right out of the bag but should loosen up with use. Nice looking and seems like good quality! Very sophisticated strap I'm excited to show it off.
customer_reviews.author: Wildberry

customer_reviews.title: Either get it on AliExpress or buy one that won’t rub you weirdly
customer_reviews.text: GET THIS ON ALIEXPRESS INSTEAD! It will be cheaper and most likely the same quality because the quality for this is okay (it’s not as comfortable as you think, get one that has a pad on the neck piece because the material for this rubs your neck weird)
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa Lira

customer_reviews.title: It carries my camera, what do you know.
customer_reviews.text: Not much to say, the reviews speak for themselves. This strap is comfortable, looks nice, and doesn't seem to have quality issues. Can't imagine it breaking/falling apart
customer_reviews.author: Teddy

customer_reviews.title: Not good for long days
customer_reviews.text: The product itself does exactly what it’s supposed to. Just beware to those using heavy cameras for a long period of time: your neck and shoulders will be sore. A harness strap I’ve found works better for a long day of filming of shooting.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t trust!
customer_reviews.text: On its third day out it completely broke! Almost damaged $6,000 worth of equipment had I not been holding it securely! Very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: B-Rad

customer_reviews.title: Lack of comfort and...
customer_reviews.text: Lacks comfort, but for the price, one can’t have too high of expectations. I’m sensitive to patterns and this one makes me dizzy. Overall, I would’ve passed on the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Kati Dvorak

customer_reviews.title: UPDATE---Get's the job done!
customer_reviews.text: I needed a camera strap with a quick release. It gets the job done and I like it. It got the job done until the end of the strap ripped. A hard enough pull did it. Good thing my camera didn't fall and hit the ground. That would have been expensive!
customer_reviews.author: Enrique V.

customer_reviews.title: Length listed is NOT the usable length!
customer_reviews.text: The length is listed as 137 cm one place and 130 cm in another, with the latter being closer. However, the usable length is no better than that of a 110 cm (43") strap I have (which correctly lists it's usable length when attached.. This item cannot be returned so buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: G. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Look, Ma; TWO hands!
customer_reviews.text: These straps are good value for money. I'm actually using them as neck straps on small 2.5 quart (~2 liter) galvanized buckets for blueberry picking. With the bucket suspended around my neck by this comfortable strap, I can pick blueberries with both hands. The straps have worked perfectly for me.
customer_reviews.author: Hans F. Von Milla

customer_reviews.title: Lots of compliments!
customer_reviews.text: I got this strap over a year ago or so. I get lots of compliments on it! I love vintage and retro looks which is one of the reasons I got it. Hasn’t failed me and I love it. It’s my go-to strap!
customer_reviews.author: a_estrada

customer_reviews.title: Great Value for Money
customer_reviews.text: You get a well-designed, comfortable and stylish camera strap that can be worn as a sling, shoulder or neck strap, that’s also excellent value for money.
customer_reviews.author: MC

customer_reviews.title: Looks great / Feels better
customer_reviews.text: feels far better on your neak than the original strap for the sony A6000/ length is great
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my vintage SLR
customer_reviews.text: Needed a new cable for my Minolta XD11 --- this one dd the trick while also having that cool retro vibe to it.
customer_reviews.author: Don Adkins

customer_reviews.title: Does the job while being cute
customer_reviews.text: It’s pretty standard strap. Cute, durible, nothing bad to say.
customer_reviews.author: cynschoettlin

customer_reviews.title: The camera pin on the strap was pretty cute.
customer_reviews.text: I just received it today! It was very fast. The strap doesn't hurt on the skin. Although the lock plastic on the thinner part strap is quite loose to the point it may get longer from how you have it adjusted but I doubt it would get too loose that it would drop your camera. The camera pin on the strap was pretty cute.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Neck Strap!
customer_reviews.text: I love this neck strap! It looks great and seems nice and sturdy. The only reason I took off one star is because I noticed a tiny bit of fraying where the fabric meets the leather, but it has not worsened as far as I can tell and it does not impede usability or comfort. Great product; would buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Jenny A.

customer_reviews.title: Durable. Easy to install.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put on the camera. Easy to adjust. Neutral- like it’s not what you notice when you see it around someone’s neck.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My wife wanted it
customer_reviews.text: So I got it for her and she likes it so she happy for now, so I am happy.....for now....
customer_reviews.author: Terry Wriste

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Used this for my Nikon D3400 and it works great. Is comfortable around the neck area and doesn’t rub. Great for slightly heavy cameras.
customer_reviews.author: lox kay

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: This is a great looking camera strap, I like the canvas material and the classic look. My camera is not very heavy so this will do just fine for me.
customer_reviews.author: J.Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Strap worked out great for my Nikon f3 feels durable and comfy enough ...
customer_reviews.text: Strap worked out great for my Nikon f3 feels durable and comfy enough around the neck when paired with a heavy analog camera
customer_reviews.author: Francisco

customer_reviews.title: Strap might come loose even if you attach it correctly.
customer_reviews.text: I attached the straps as the instructions stated, but one side came undone already. Luckily, it wasn't while it was around my neck!! It is slightly better than the Nikon strap that came with my camera, but it doesn't impress me. You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Not full length
customer_reviews.text: I received this strap to use with my Canon 7D, the strap was slightly shorter than the factory strap and for such a big camera really does not work well. I was hoping to return it but this shop doesn't accept returns. Spend a few extra bucks and pass on this strap.
customer_reviews.author: Halli Goolsby

customer_reviews.title: Trustworthy strap
customer_reviews.text: Thus far trustworthy strap. Comfort is decent, unsure of long time wear though as I only wear mine for about 1 to 2 hours.
customer_reviews.author: A Gilded Jade

customer_reviews.title: Looks good
customer_reviews.text: The Main strap is sturdy and well constructed. It falls short if you want to use the quick release option as that part is able to hold only a fraction of the weight.
customer_reviews.author: MasterMind

customer_reviews.title: Nice and simple
customer_reviews.text: I like that this strap has a light weight feel to it along with a minimal style. I dislike the plastic strap holders that keep sliding around and not staying in place.
customer_reviews.author: Shane  Brock

customer_reviews.title: Attractive at a Reasonable price.
customer_reviews.text: Love this camera strap! It’s so attractive. I feel like a real professional using it. Strap very secure. So great for such a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Tucker8

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: It feels really nice and sturdy so far. Will update when I start using it in the field.
customer_reviews.author: Damien

customer_reviews.title: Good price for a nice looking strap
customer_reviews.text: Decent camera strap for the price. I liked the vintage look for my nikon f2 and f3 cameras, and it feels sturdy enough to carry these without fear of falling. Just make sure you don't use the plastic clips to connect it to the camera. Only problem I had is that it's a little scratchy on my neck. This only happens when I'm hiking or moving around a lot, so if you're just walking it probably won't be too much of a problem. For the price I can't complain too much.
customer_reviews.author: Christian

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: So much better then the native strap for the GH5, love the look of it too!
customer_reviews.author: Zac G.

customer_reviews.title: Good,sturdy strap
customer_reviews.text: Bought this strap for my grandson, for his new camera. He said it’s very sturdy and durable.
customer_reviews.author: Butterflyjen

customer_reviews.title: Looks Good, Feels great, Functions well
customer_reviews.text: Looks Good, Feels great, Functions well. Great value and good looking flair.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for me.
customer_reviews.text: The strap doesn't lock in place or maybe was missing hardware?). I was 1 second away from my camera falling onto a concrete floor.
customer_reviews.author: FL Z-People 777

customer_reviews.title: Carry a Tarion and know your camera is safely on you
customer_reviews.text: Although inexpensive, this neck strap for the price is amazingly good. It is inexpensive, but not cheap. If you are considering a replacement to your current camera strap, you might like this one.
customer_reviews.author: Stuart Riley

customer_reviews.title: Great length, looks great too
customer_reviews.text: Love the length, and adjustability. Strength is excellent, and looks sharp feels nice on shoulders and neck.
customer_reviews.author: GPD

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Camera Strap!
customer_reviews.text: This strap is very nice. Easy to attach, comfortable on the shoulder, ,nice looking. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: HerDellness

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera Strap
customer_reviews.text: I was in need of a new camera strap and this one gave me the vintage look with a high quality material.
customer_reviews.author: Rogër Rojas

customer_reviews.title: Cute
customer_reviews.text: Really cute. Simply love it! And it's really sturdy. Holds my canon t5i really easily.
customer_reviews.author: Ana

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Love it got it for my canon ae 1 unfortunately I dont use it anymore because film photography is just too expensive without Costco...lol but very sturdy and simple, beautiful, unique design
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth the 10 bucks
customer_reviews.text: Not the greatest camera strap ever, but I wasn’t expecting it to be. It works and it’s kinda fashionable while it does so. That’s all I could really ask for for the price.
customer_reviews.author: D. Zavala

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Love the look and more so the comfortability. Works great!
customer_reviews.author: Sean David

customer_reviews.title: Great straps at a very affordable price.
customer_reviews.text: These work very well on my Olympus and Fuji cameras!
customer_reviews.author: 1inventorTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality and it goes with everything better than some ...
customer_reviews.text: Cute. Nice quality and it goes with everything better than some of the crazy patterned straps.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Bignami

customer_reviews.title: carry on!
customer_reviews.text: really comfortable and resistant. i have an old tlr yashica and it feels good with it.

product_meta.title: TARION Camera Shoulder Neck Strap Vintage Belt for All DSLR Camera Nikon Canon Sony Pentax Classic White and Brown Weave
feature_bullets: [Classic and Vintage] This vintage and classic camera strap is made of high quality and durable cotton yarn and PU leather.
[Strong and Comfy] Anti-slip surface helps to prevent accidental slip of your expensive equipments.
[Adjustable Length] Ergonomically adjustable length on both ends for all photographers at different heights, total length:137cm; strap length: 71cm; Strap width: 3.8cm.
[Extremely Lightweight] Soft and sturdy material can help to reduce pressure on the back of neck, while with a weight of approximate 65g makes it comfortable to wear.

[Hold all cameras and NOT JUST for cameras] The latest upgraded version is with a metal triangle which makes the strap perfect in safety and perfectly compatible with all brands of DSLR cameras like Canon, Fuji, Nikon, Olympus, Panasonic, Pentax, Sony, Instax, Polaroid etc. while it can be used for other equipments like some binoculars, monoculars, rangefinders, tools, and so on.
